result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley R Tomesh

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Riley R Tomesh in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE provided with copy of amended complaint.  DE is eligible for public defender. AIA set for 11/9/2022 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with N.T., DOB 3/23/11.
Must have no contact with S.M.K. 
Must have no unsupervised contact with any minor.

2:45 PM Defendant Riley R Tomesh appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Riley R Tomesh, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge and Court reporter appeared by video. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 
State relates to bond.
Attorney Kitto relates.
State will file an amended complaint.
Court sets bond.
Next hearing to be in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
